modules.description: Provides parallel mapping over lists and arrays using thread pools, with support for bounded concurrency and custom scheduling. Operates on heterogeneous data structures including lists, arrays, and lazy sequences. Enables efficient processing of I/O-bound tasks such as concurrent API calls or file reads.

Provides operations to create and manipulate byte arrays, including conversion from strings, memory-mapped loading, and blitting data. Works with Bigarray-based types for efficient storage and access of raw bytes and 64-bit floats. Used for low-level data serialization, buffer management, and high-performance data transfers.

The module offers parallelized map, fold, and mapfold operations on lists, arrays, and float arrays, with adjustable parallelism granularity via chunksize to balance workload across cores. It supports specialized handling of float arrays for high-performance numerical computations and includes mechanisms for core pinning and load balancing. Use cases include processing large datasets or computationally intensive tasks where efficient multithreading is critical, such as scientific simulations or data transformation pipelines.

Logs error messages with formatted strings, appends and concatenates lists, folds right over lists, generates integer ranges, and creates temporary file descriptors. Operates on lists, integers, and file descriptors. Used for error handling, list manipulation, and temporary file management in system-level operations.

Returns the number of available CPU cores and allows setting the core count for process execution. Works with integer values representing CPU core counts. Used to control parallelism in multi-threaded applications or performance-critical code sections.

Processes binary files by mapping memory regions, supporting custom offsets, data types, and layouts. It operates on file descriptors, Bigarrays, and integer arrays to enable efficient data access. Used for reading structured binary data such as sensor logs or image files.
